content: I am the wife of a Persian Gulf War Vet. We have been married 14 years May 25, 2009. We have NO CHILDREN. My husband was told by a VA doctor after going through tests that he has "LOW MOTILITY" in his sperm. Over the past few years we have met countless couples with the EXACT same diagnosis that are military vets from Persian Gulf. I am now collecting names, addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, and signed statements from every vet I can find with this same diagnosis. If you have this diagnosis please contact me.

title: LOW MOTILITY IN VETS OF PERSIAN GULF WAR

content: First, I want to assure you that we all want to help you find the answers you need and deserve. Thanks for standing by your man and please give his our thanks for his service. Try posting your question HERE Please keep us posted. Blessings, God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans
